thread.title: Fourth Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Set at Southern Miss
thread.title_full: Fourth Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Set at Southern Miss

author: Austin Simmons
title: Fourth Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Set at Southern Miss
text:
Fourth Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Set at Southern - WDAM-TV 7-News, Weather, Sports-Hattiesburg, MS Member Center: Fourth Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Set at Southern Miss Posted: austinsimmons@wdam.com 
News release from Southern Miss Athletics 
HATTIESBURG, Miss. - The Southern Miss baseball team will hold its 4th annual Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series, a five-game set, from Tuesday, Oct. 27, through Tuesday, Nov. 3 at Pete Taylor Park/Hill Denson Field. Admission is free to all five games, but donations will be accepted for breast cancer awareness.The Golden Eagles will be split up into two squads with senior pitchers Luke Lowery and Cody Livingston each serving as a head coach for one of the teams. 
The series opens with a 6 p.m., contest on Tuesday, Oct. 27, and finishes, Tuesday, Nov. 3, at 6 p.m. During the final game of the series, the baseball team will recognize the Waiting for a Cure Foundation."We have tied in our fall intra-squad world series with something we think is very important for four years now and we just feel fortunate that we are able to try and help those in need in our community that are undergoing treatment for breast cancer,” said seventh-year Southern Miss baseball coach Scott Berry.The completion of the series will conclude fall practice for the Golden Eagle squad. The 2016 season begins Friday, Feb. 19, when the Golden Eagles host Eastern Illinois at 4 p.m.Below is the schedule of the fall world series games: 2015 Southern Miss Baseball Breast Cancer Awareness Fall World Series Schedule Tuesday, Oct. 27 - 6 p.m.Friday, Oct. 30 – 3 p.m.Saturday, Oct. 31 – 9 a.m.Sunday, Nov. 1 - 2 p.m.Tuesday, Nov. 3 - 6 p.m.(All games to be played at Pete Taylor Park/Hill Denson Field and admission is free) Can't Find Something?
